name: VacationRenter
desc: Worked on the design and evolution of a large-scale vacation rental platform built to handle high traffic volumes and rapid growth. I contributed to a containerized microservices architecture using Docker and Kubernetes, enabling reliable service isolation, consistent environments, and smooth scalability across production systems. I helped design and maintain an automated CI/CD pipeline that streamlined build, test, and deployment workflows, significantly improving release velocity while reducing operational risk.

name: Cowboy
desc: Contributed to the development and evolution of Cowboy's digital platform, supporting the online presence of a connected e-bike brand focused on urban mobility and smart hardware experiences. I worked on scalable, user-facing systems that showcased products, technical features, and customer services such as test rides, leasing, accessories, and warranty management, ensuring a seamless experience from discovery through purchase. My work focused on building and maintaining reliable, performance-oriented web services and frontend integrations that supported high traffic volumes across multiple regions. I collaborated closely with product, design, and engineering teams to translate business and brand requirements into robust technical solutions, while ensuring the platform remained responsive, maintainable, and aligned with Cowboy's connected-device ecosystem. Throughout the project, I emphasized clean architecture, system reliability, and long-term scalability to support both e-commerce growth and evolving product capabilities.

name: Trioclear Smile Generator
desc: Worked on the development of an AI-powered web application that generates realistic smile previews by aligning teeth using a self-hosted machine learning model. I contributed to building the end-to-end workflow that allows users to securely upload dental images, process them through an internal AI inference pipeline, and return visually accurate, near-real-time results through a responsive web interface.My work focused on integrating the self-hosted AI model into scalable backend services, optimizing image processing performance, and ensuring reliable handling of user uploads. I collaborated closely with product, design, and clinical stakeholders to balance accuracy, usability, and system reliability, while implementing secure data handling practices suitable for sensitive medical imagery. Throughout the project, I emphasized maintainable architecture, performance optimization, and a smooth user experience to support both clinical use and consumer-facing interactions.
